Instruction: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, sugar, and vanilla until well combined. Slowly add in the cream while continuing to whisk until the mixture is smooth.

Place a damp kitchen cloth in the bottom of a large baking pan, and arrange the filled ramekins on top. Carefully pour boiling water into the baking pan until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Cover the pan loosely with aluminum foil.

Bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the custard is set but still slightly wobbly in the center. Remove ramekins from the water bath and allow to cool, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until chilled.
Allow the custard to set in the refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours.
